_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Tri-Rotor Crop Service LLC is an agricultural retail business that specializes providing the necessary inputs for grain production for production agriculture. Tri-Rotor Crop Services strives to maintain a safe and healthy work place. Our owners, managers, and employees have made every effort to plan the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

The worst case and the alternate release scenarios have been evaluated and shared with our local first responders as part of an on-going training program. More importantly, our employees have been trained in their respective emergency actions, including the emergency meeting place and each of their individual responsibilities regarding an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. Tri Rotor Crop Services LLC's Milepost ammonia plant consists of 2 bulk tanks, 1-30,000 and 1-26,000 gallon bulk tanks. And 20 1000 gallon nurse tanks for a total plant capacity of 333,000 pounds of ammonia. 

Tri Rotor Crop Services LLC  maintains and operates their anhydrous ammonia plant in strict accordance with all state and local authorities. The Kansas Department of Agriculture (KDA) inspects our plant on a regular basis and we comply with their requests for improvement. Changes or improvements in the facility?s equipment will be acted upon immediately following the enforcement agency (KDA?s) request, or as found to be necessary by our staff.

Our employees are trained in safety procedures, site specific operating procedures, plant maintenance and employees are competency tested over the training material. Each employee uses ammonia proof goggles and gloves during ammonia operations as well ass always providing plenty of emergency safety water during nurse tank and maintenance operations. 

With the above-mentioned training in mind, it makes it very easy to report that absolutely no injury actions or property damage have occurred at this facility for the past 5 years. 

Our emergency action plan is designed to minimize the ris

ks to employees, the surrounding public, and the area first responders.  Tri-Rotor Crop Services LLC provides plant tours for our local fire department and our action plan has been shared with the Grant County Local Emergency Planning Commission (LEPC). Each of our responding agencies are aware of the dangerous nature of anhydrous ammonia and they have agreed to assist us in the event of an emergency or accidental release.
